overview: A chronological breakdown of events leading to the adventure. Use this to understand character motivations and answer player questions about the past.

timeline.label: PROJECT HEIRLOOM BEGINS
events: First generation of Type-H subjects created with the 'Lattice' iris marker.

timeline.label: THE OAKHAVEN GENERATION
events: Bio-Dyne distributes the stabilizer via 'Bio-Dyne Pure' water bottles.

timeline.label: THE LIQUIDATION
events: Bio-Dyne moves to liquidate the project.
Mercenaries approach Jax (15). They ask for the Maintenance Access Chip to 'cut the power and flush the squatters' so the building can be sold.
Jax, believing it is a non-lethal eviction, trades the chip for a transit pass. He keeps the chip as a lucky charm.
Mercenaries use the chip's access to reverse the airflow and pump nerve gas. Hundreds die.
Elena remains frozen in a concealed room.
Residents flood the local message board with panic as the doors lock.

timeline.label: PRESENT DAY
events: Jax is 30. He is dying. He still carries the chip, unaware it holds the logs of his complicity.
Elena's subconscious has begun to leak into the facility's local intranet.

keyRelationships.jaxAndRattle: Childhood friends. Rattle knows Jax traded the vent codes. They haven't spoken in 15 years.
keyRelationships.jaxAndElena: Jax never knew Elena personally. To him, she's just a compatible donor - a means to survive.
keyRelationships.rattleAndHazers: Rattle is their leader and protector. He watches them die one by one and can do nothing.
keyRelationships.playerAndJax: The player thinks Jax is a friend and employer. The truth is more complicated.

theStingInTheTail.revelation: Even if Jax receives Elena's heart, the genetic timebomb is not cured.
theStingInTheTail.reason: The killswitch is in his DNA, not his organs. Elena's heart will slow his decline, but it won't stop it.
theStingInTheTail.outcome: All Elena's sacrifice buys him is time. Months. Maybe a year.
theStingInTheTail.tragedy: There is no happy ending. The choice is between a quick death and a slow one - and whether an innocent woman dies for those extra months.

gmNotes: Use this timeline to answer player questions and maintain consistency. Key dramatic beats: Jax's guilt (he helped kill these people), the mystery of simultaneous illness (the timebomb), and the final revelation (even saving Jax doesn't really save him).
